intro: Scrophularia kabadianensis, commonly known as the Kabardian figwort, is a flowering plant species native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae, which includes a variety of herbaceous plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, often in areas with high altitude and cool climates. It produces showy, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Scrophularia kabadianensis is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, which help it adapt to its harsh environment.
